page.title: 09Anstruther Community School
page.content: 10 years ago Waid first opened in the evenings and the weekends as a community centre. There are endless clubs and classes, both vocational and non-vocational for all ages during the winter such as self defence, badminton swimming, football, cricket, fencing, weight training, rugby, disco fitness, dancerobics, slimnastics, dance, yoga, speak Italian,typing, painting, health food cooking, pottery, guitar, Junior Operatic and Pipe Band. You can even hold your birthday party in Waid using the pool, the hall and the cafeteria for about Â£5. In the summer the centre is used by tourists and locals. They can use the pool, play badminton, carpet bowls, swingball, table tennis, putting, or have a snack in the cafeteria. During the winter the group uses Waid about 3 times every week.
